edge: The films were produced by Michael De Luca Productions and secured by Universal Pictures and Focus Features in March 2012. James Foley will direct both sequels, which will be shot back-to-back in 2016 with Niall Leonard writing the script and Michael De Luca and Dana Brunetti returning to produce, along with E. L. James and Marcus Viscidi.
In November 2015, Universal Studios announced that Fifty Shades Darker and Fifty Shades Freed would be shot back-to-back.
Dakota Johnson will return to play the lead role in Fifty Shades Darker and Fifty Shades Freed.
Jamie Dornan will return to play the lead role in Fifty Shades Darker and Fifty Shades Freed.
In February 2016, Arielle Kebbel was cast in the film to play Gia Matteo.
In February 2016, Eric Johnson was cast as Jack Hyde.
In February 2016, Brant Daugherty signed on to play Sawyer.
The two films, Fifty Shades Darker and Fifty Shades Freed, will be shot back-to-back in early 2016 due to Universal Studios' announcement in November 2015.

Filming for both Fifty Shades Darker and Fifty Shades Freed took place in Paris from February 9, 2016, to July 12, 2016, as well as Vancouver under the working title 'Further Adventures of Max and Banks 2 & 3'.
